Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is covered in parts with traces of a granular deposit, the exterior, ribbed in part, is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of one line of red-painted text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394199) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394199)
